definition: to hack/to chop/to split open/(of lightning) to strike
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: Huge waves came crashing almost on top of us.
If your employer isn't already aware of your plans, ask for a meeting to explain.
sentences.chinese: 假如店主還不知道你的謀劃，請求劈面解釋。

sentences.english: He couldn't open his eyes when the gale was blowing dead against him.
sentences.chinese: 劈面吹來的狂風使他睜不開眼睛。

sentences.english: While tearing down the banner he had received a sword-cut across his face.
sentences.chinese: 他在拔旗時，劈面砍來一刀，正砍着他的臉。

sentences.english: And just across the street will be the world-renowned Rockefeller Center.
sentences.chinese: 劈面年夜街便是譽滿天下的洛克斐勒中央。

sentences.english: Noise level is bad, the small construction site opposite the hotel works 24 hours non stop.
sentences.chinese: 噪音情況很嚴重，劈面的工地24小時連續勞動。

sentences.english: Sixty cannons and the thirteen squares darted lightning point-blank on the cuirassiers.
sentences.chinese: 六十尊大炮和十三個方陣同時向着鐵騎軍劈面射來。

sentences.english: The wind of change, blows straight into the face of time.
sentences.chinese: 變遷的風，劈面給了時光一記耳光。

definition: (idiom) no sooner said than done/before you know it
pinyin: shuo1 shi2 chi2 , na4 shi2 kuai4

definition: with a lightning move of the hand
coming right into one's face/imminent/to put first
lit. without head, without face (idiom)/fig. frenzily/haphazardly
lit. sth hits one in the face/directly in one's face/sth assaults the senses/blatant (advertising)/eye-catching/(a smell) assaults the nostrils
Buddhist monk's knife (not used for killing)
the staff of a Buddhist monk
